ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My knowledge of German
My verbal and writing skills really improved during the course. We discussed some very interesting topics, such as women's soccer, LBGTQ communities in soccer and racism.
I became a much stronger speaker (both formally and conversationally). I also improved my grammar and writing styles dramatically with Frau Sippel's help.

We learned that the history of German soccer is complex, politically turbulent, and reflects a lot of social trends. 
We also covered a bunch of grammar topics like "Indirekte Rede".
Great way to practice German, grammar help
I developed a better understanding of Germany's culture through the lens of soccer, learned about new/complex grammar, and developed my speaking and listening skills.

In addition to learning a lot about professional soccer itself, I learned about how soccer interacts with different intersectionalities in German-speaking countries. Our units covered racism, sexism, and homophobia, as well as German history (post-war, East/West divide). With helpful grammar lessons (aligning with the content) throughout the course, my German language got a lot better, as well!
I learned a lot of vocabulary about German soccer and social issues. I learned a lot about how social issues influence Soccer and other sports.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Great material. I loved the readings!

I was always excited to go to class, I really liked how they were built up. We had a lot of discussions and I think there was a great balance between speaking, listening and grammar tasks. I loved when we played quizlet or kahoot.
Strengths  small class with passionate students. Compassionate and understanding professor that prioritizes learning over unnecessary stress.

Strengths -- Liese is a great teacher; workload was pretty low; played soccer in our final class which was really fun 
Weaknesses -- would've been cool to learn more about the contemporary German soccer team
Well paced, frequent but small assignments
Strengths are the professor and weaknesses are occasions where students dominate the conversation.

Professor Sippel took suggestions throughout the course for what grammatical topic should be practiced next, which was really helpful. We wrote a lot in the course, which felt like a lot of work when it coincided with a usual reading assignment, but having this much writing in general was necessary for improving my German, I think. We also got a lot of prompt feedback throughout the course on our homeworks, which was great for improving throughout the semester. And the mix of videos, articles, and book chapters was a real strength of this course in terms of exposing us to a diversity of media/accents.

So many strengths in this class! I really enjoyed the balance between watching movies and documentaries, reading extracts from books, and reading articles. Even though the topic of the class is fairly niche, each unit felt very different and I learned a lot about various social issues in Germany/Switzerland. Really reasonable, balanced workload and honestly no complaints or weaknesses.
Strengths: Really well structured, assignments felt useful, the topic is so helpful in learning about German culture.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! Great instructor!!

I would recommend this course to anyone, who is interesting in soccer (you are going to love this course!!) or just in sports in general. Liese is really great, and the whole class had very good vibes/atmosphere.
Yes! Even if you are not interested in soccer or even any sports, it is a wonderful German class to take.
Yes! One of my favorite German classes that I've taken at Yale.
I would  great for language learners
I would recommend this course to any German student/learner who enjoys learning about German culture. Even if you're not a soccer fan!

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. In addition to it being just plain fun and a great conversation topic, it really helped me brush up on my German, and I learned in-depth about a topic that is really important to German culture. Plus, the cross-section of Yale that I got to meet through the class was really great. The students attracted to a German class all about soccer are each super interesting in their own right!

Absolutely would recommend! It's an interesting, not at all stressful class that will teach you German grammar and vocab, alongside insights into how football influences various aspects of German culture. Definitely a good first L5 class.
Yes! Liese is an amazing professor and the course is so interesting.
